code... --> |postal_code = |area_code = (+62) 287 |website = {{URL|kec-gombong.kebumenkab.go.id}} |footnotes = |area_code_type = [[Telephone numbers in Indonesia|Area code]] |blank_name = [[administrative village|Villages]] |blank_info = 14 }} '''Gombong''' is a [[list of districts of Central Java|town]] in [[Kebumen Regency]], in the southern part of [[Central Java]], a province in [[Indonesia]]. The town has 47,410 inhabitants.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://kebumenkab.bps.go.id/linkTabelStatis/view/id/5|title=Badan Pusat Statistik Kabupaten Kebumen|website=kebumenkab.bps.go.id|access-date=2016-07-20}}</ref> The total land area is 19.48 kmÂ². Local people speak [[Banyumasan language|Banyumasan]], a dialect of [[Javanese language|Javanese]].
In 1964, construction of the Catholic Church of St. Michael Parish was completed. In 1996,the ''Wonokriyo market'' was built, becoming the biggest one in the region. A few dinosaur statues are located around the city: at the entrance of Fort Van der Wijck, at Tirta Manggala Swimming Pools and at Sempor Reservoir.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.gombong-guide.com/2011/07/see-dinosaurs-in-district-gombong.html |title=See the dinosaurs in district Gombong |access-date=2011-08-06 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110725110445/http://www.gombong-guide.com/2011/07/see-dinosaurs-in-district-gombong.html |archive-date=2011-07-25 |url-status=dead }}</ref> Not far from the city, the prayer house [[Geraja Ayam]], also known as the ''chicken church'', is built.
Fort Van der Wijck, which was built in the early 19th century by General [[Johannes Van den Bosch]], is located in the northern part of the city.<ref>[http://indahnesia.com/indonesia/JAWWIJ/fort_van_der_wijck.php History of Fort Van der Wijk]</ref> The military compound served to train soldiers for later service in the [[Royal Netherlands East Indies Army]]. [[Suharto]], the second [[President of Indonesia]], began his service here on 1 June 1940 prior to the [[Japanese occupation of Indonesia|Japanese occupation]]).<ref name="ELSON2">{{cite book | first = Robert E. | last = Elson | year = 2001 | title = Suharto: A Political Biography | page=8 | publisher = Cambridge University Press | location = Cambridge, United Kingdom | isbn = 0-521-77326-1}}</ref> The fort was used by the [[Indonesian Armed Forces]] until 2000. Since then the compound has been developed as a recreational site.
==Administrative villages== Gombong consists of 14 [[Administrative village|villages]] (''kelurahan'' or ''desa'') namely: # Banjarsari # Gombong # Kalitengah # Kedungpuji # Kemukus # Klopogodo # Panjangsari # Patemon # Semanding # Semondo # Sidayu # Wero # Wonokriyo # Wonosigro
==Notable people== * [[Maus Gatsonides]] (1911), Dutch rally driver and inventor of the [[speed camera]]. * [[Jan Hamer]] (1927), Dutch survivor during Hurricane Katrina featured in the 2007 book ''Holding Out and Hanging On: Surviving Hurricane Katrina'' by Thomas Neff.
